articles.summary: Fast Radio Bursts Reveal Where The Universe's Missing Matter Is Hiding The radio light from fast radio bursts changes as it travels through the intergalactic medium. (ESA/Hubble & NASA) By tracing powerful radio signals back to their host galaxies near the beginning of time, astrophysicists have pinpointed where the Universe's missing matter is hiding. articles.title: Astronomers discover a tiny star with a giant planet that should not exist - Earth.com
articles.summary: Astronomers discover a tiny star with a giant planet that should not exist Astronomers have spotted a giant exoplanet, named TOI-6894b, that’s bigger than Saturn and circling a red dwarf star only one-fifth the mass of the Sun. This finding rewrites expectations about where massive planets can form and hints that such worlds may be common around the smallest stars.
